title: test_annex_ssh failure due to non-existent socket (again)
body:
In the most recent Travis build on master, [one job][0] had a failure in `test_annex_ssh`:

```
======================================================================
FAIL: datalad.support.tests.test_annexrepo.test_annex_ssh
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.8.1/lib/python3.8/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.8.1/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 271, in newfunc
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.8.1/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 731, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.8.1/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/support/tests/test_annexrepo.py", line 1202, in test_annex_ssh
    ok_(exists(socket_2))
AssertionError: None
```

That failure has come up before in an earlier iteration of gh-4762. I thought I worked around it with b46b4cbbcd (TST: test_annex_ssh: Avoid syncing unrelated histories, 2020-07-21). A similar (but not identical) failure popped up in gh-4768 (which was before the Docker ssh switch), and that failure didn't show up after the changes from the above commit were cherry picked.

So, despite b46b4cbbcd appearing to clear up the failures in those PRs, it seems it's still an issue.

[0]: https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/712974813#L2001
